posts.message:
First of all, if you didn't, please check that out. https://www.facebook.com/groups/egyptian.geeks/permalink/885359084837134/

The chrome extension part of that project is done, so now's the time to finish the back-end, but well... I've got a little problem there...

Originally I'm a PHP developer, but I work with a framework I've made myself. I edited some front-class-interface file I've found out somewhere and I combined it with Symfony2's Universal Class Loader. It was a difficult job but it ended up as something perfectly customized for my needs, I used that to implement few projects and it was perfect.

But when I think about this project, I need to use something that has more solid rules, like a solid framework or so. I tried CodeIgniter but honestly I don't believe it would be the perfect choice for something like that, especially after the discontinued support and then lending it to another organization and so.

I never worked with NodeJS nor Meteor (and I mentioned Meteor because even though it's not popular, I've heard incredibly positive feedback about it) so I don't know whether those would be a better choice or not.

So, what do you guys think? Which framework should I use for something like that? Or should I use my native thing?

EDIT:

The back-end should be a simple API that receives some data and returns a URL. There's a lot of processing done in the background though, specifically MHTML to HTML conversion and a lot of regex stuff. There should also be protection against spam so there will be a database that logs user entries where old entries get purged every while and then.
